title: Westfield Hornsby brazen theft as trio make off with Apple Watches from store
text:
A group of thieves stole more than two dozen Apple Watches in a series of brazen daylight robberies, only to later realise they were worthless display products.

The three men stole the watches from stores in Sydney and Lake Macquarie in New South Wales during a series of heists.

Unbeknownst to the thieves, the watches were display products only - meaning they lacked the features that see the product retail for up to $800.

A group of thieves stole dozens of Apple Watches in a brazen daylight robbery only to realise they were display products

The trio were captured on CCTV during the second theft at an Apple store at Westfield Hornsby in Sydney's north-west on October 2.

The men were seen grabbing display model Apple Watches before running out of the store.

Police believe the theft is linked to a similar incident in Charlestown, Lake Macquarie in September.

The three men are Caucasian and are believed to be aged in their mid-to-late teens.

Police have warned potential buyers to be cautious of any second-hand Apple Watches that are offered for sale.

CCTV footage showed the trio enter the Apple Store and loiter around a counter to inspect the watches on display

authors: Aidan Wondracz For Daily Mail Australia
